Class TetristryApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • TetristryApp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class TetristryApp
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This is the driver class for Tetristry. This will set up the frame and all the panel classes. Extends JFrame, implements ActionListener.
    Version:
    2.5, May 15th, 2014
    Author:
    Richard Dang and Benson Guo
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TetristryApp

        public TetristryApp()
        Constructor which sets up the file and help menubar, and the frame. Shortcut keys are added to allow access to menu items. An image is loaded into the background. A frame is created, with size 800 by 800, and is not resizable. An icon of the program is added. The menubar items are instantiated and added. The menubar is instatiated. ActionListeners are added to the menubar items. The frame is set visible. A windowlistener is added.
        Parameters:
        fileMenu-reference - variable for JMenu item "File".
        helpMenu-reference - variable for JMenu item "Help".
        myMenus-reference - variable for JMenuBar item.
        myIcon-reference - variable for BufferedImage from File (".\\Images/Images\Icon.png").
        windowListener-reference - varaible for WindowListener.

    • Method Detail

      • enableDisableMenuItems

        public static void enableDisableMenuItems()
        Enables or disables the menu items.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        The actionPerformed method calls methods based on the menubar choices clicked by the user through an if statement. If the "Quit" option is clicked the program will exit. If the "Tutorial" option is clicked the program will display the tutorial panel. If the "About" option is clicked the program will pause the game and display the about dialog. If the "Instructions" option is clicked the program will display the instructions panel. If the "Highscore" option is clicked the program will display the highscore panel. If the "Print Highscore" option is clicked the program will pause the game and ask the user to confirm. If the "Help Me" option is clicked the program will display the CHM Help file.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae-reference - variable for ActionEvent.

      • levelPanel

        public static void levelPanel()
        Static method used by the Menu class to remove the current panel, access the level selection panel and set the current panel as the level panel.

      • gamePanel

        public static void gamePanel()
        Static method used by the Menu class to remove the current panel, access the game panel and set the current panel as the game panel.

      • pauseResumeGameBoard

        public static void pauseResumeGameBoard()
        Static method that pauses the gameboard if the user tries to access a menu item. If they select 'no' on the confirmation dialog, the game resumes.

      • highScorePanel

        public static void highScorePanel()
        Static method used by the Menu class to remove the current panel, access the highscore panel and set the current panel as the highscore panel. Pauses the game if the player is current in the game panel and asks them if they want to end their current game. If not, the game resumes.

      • instructionsPanel

        public static void instructionsPanel()
        Static method used by the Menu class to remove the current panel, access the instructions panel and set the current panel as the instructions panel. Pauses the game if the player is current in the game panel and asks them if they want to end their current game. If not, the game resumes.

      • tutorialPanel

        public static void tutorialPanel()
        Static method used by the Menu class to remove the current panel, access the tutorial panel and set the current panel as the tutorial panel. Pauses the game if the player is current in the game panel and asks them if they want to end their current game. If not, the game resumes.

      • changePanel

        public static void changePanel(char panel)
        Static method used to remove the current panel.

      • menuPanel

        public static void menuPanel()
        Static method used by panel classes to remove the current panel, access the menu panel and set the current panel as the menu panel. During this time, the menu items are enabled.

      • splashScreen

        public static void splashScreen()
        Static method used display the splashscreen on the intial launch of the program.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Constructs the Driver class and all the panel classes which begins with the splash screen then the main menu.
